description.heading: TECHNICAL FIELD
description.p: The present technology relates to an imaging control apparatus and method, and a vehicle and particularly relates to an imaging control apparatus and method, and a vehicle capable of efficiently analyzing images.
description.heading: BACKGROUND ART
description.p: Various proposals have been made to enable a driver to safely drive a vehicle. For example, it has been proposed to use a radar to scan the front of the vehicle so as to control to notify the driver with a warning or automatically operate the brake when another vehicle or an obstacle is sensed. Furthermore, it has also been proposed to automatically control the traveling speed so as to set the distance to the vehicle traveling ahead to an appropriate distance.

Moreover, there is also a known technique of photographing to recognize white lines and road signs on a road, or the like, using a video camera, and to present the information to the driver of the vehicle as necessary (for example, refer to Patent Documents 1). From US 2009/0225189 A1, an image sensing system is known, which supports independent setting of sensor parameters in two or more different regions of interest. For instance, exposure time and gain are independently selectable in each region of interest. JP 2012-029029 A pertains to an image processing device, method and program for generating an output image having a different gradation characteristic, which is achieved by converting luminance information of an input image.

description.heading: SUMMARY OF THE INVENTION
PROBLEMS TO BE SOLVED BY THE INVENTION
description.p: Meanwhile, driving support requires quick response. The longer the response time is, the longer the vehicle travel distance within that time, leading to a failure in giving a support in time. For this reason, for example, efficient image analysis would be desired in a case where a vehicle surrounding is photographed and the photographed image is analyzed to sense the presence or absence of an obstacle or the like.
The present technology has been made in view of such a situation and aims to enable efficient image analysis.
description.heading: SOLUTIONS TO PROBLEMS
description.p: According to a first solution, the present invention provides an imaging control apparatus in accordance with independent claim 1. According to a second solution, the present invention provides an imaging control method in accordance with independent claim 4. According to a third solution, the present invention provides a vehicle in accordance with independent claim 5. Further aspects of the invention are set forth in the dependent claims, the drawings and the following description.

An aspect of the present technology not including all the features of the invention as defined in claim 1 is an imaging control apparatus including: a controller that causes a short accumulation signal of a preceding frame to correspond to the short accumulation signal of a succeeding frame; and a processor that uses the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame to process the signal of the succeeding frame.

The apparatus is configured such that the controller causes short accumulation exposure for generating the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame to correspond to the short accumulation exposure for generating the short accumulation signal of the succeeding frame, and the processor uses the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame to apply tone conversion on a composite signal of the short accumulation signal and a long accumulation signal of the succeeding frame.
The preceding frame and the succeeding frame can constitute an N-frame sequence.

The apparatus includes an examination unit that applies histogram examination on the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame to generate a tone conversion curve, and the processor is configured to perform tone conversion on the basis of the tone conversion curve.
The examination unit can apply histogram examination on a composite signal obtained by combining the short accumulation signal and the long accumulation signal of the preceding frame.
The controller is configured to control the exposure of the succeeding frame on the basis of the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame.
The apparatus can further include a recognition unit that recognizes a recognition target from the signal that has undergone tone conversion.
An aspect of the present technology is an imaging control method according to claim 4.
An aspect of the present technology is a vehicle according to claim 5.

According to the invention, the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame is set to correspond to the short accumulation signal of the succeeding frame, and the short accumulation signal of the preceding frame is used to process the signal of the succeeding frame.
description.heading: EFFECTS OF THE INVENTION
description.p: As described above, according to an aspect of the present technology, it is possible to efficiently analyze an image. Note that effects described here in the present specification are provided for purposes of exemplary illustration and are not intended to be limiting. Still other additional effects may also be contemplated.
